adrFormatAddress: 2246 1st Ave., New York, NY 10029, USA

originalText.text: I LOVE this place! This was my first time and Guadalupe did an amazing job! She took her time and made sure every nail was perfect. I'm definitely coming back!

text.text: I LOVE this place! This was my first time and Guadalupe did an amazing job! She took her time and made sure every nail was perfect. I'm definitely coming back!

originalText.text: Awesome customer service, they take their time and they CARE. The shop is beautiful and VERY CLEAN. The owner is so sweet. I would recommend for anyone and all! Great experience and attentiveness . I was definitely pleased

text.text: Awesome customer service, they take their time and they CARE. The shop is beautiful and VERY CLEAN. The owner is so sweet. I would recommend for anyone and all! Great experience and attentiveness . I was definitely pleased

originalText.text: I would love to support this Latina owned business. But on numerous occasions the service was poor. I scheduled appointments online and once I had to wait over a hour to be seen. And the second time the person I scheduled with wasn‚Äôt working there anymore. Another time I was bounced around with technicians because they were short staffed. Second of all their skill isn‚Äôt great. I only liked my nails once after getting it done here. And the worst of all the owner isn‚Äôt friendly. She‚Äôs not mean but she‚Äôs no warm at all. I did follow her on IG and expected a welcoming personality. But she always looks so upset. You do so much better with the right attitude and management.

text.text: I would love to support this Latina owned business. But on numerous occasions the service was poor. I scheduled appointments online and once I had to wait over a hour to be seen. originalText.text: I can't even with how awesome my visit to Fierce Spa in Harlem was. Literally from the moment I walked in, Guadalupe, the owner, was like the sweetest person ever. We had the best chat, and I just absolutely LOVED her. So, I decided to go all out and get a full set of acrylics, and omg they were perfect. Like best nails I‚Äôve ever had, and I‚Äôm not even exaggerating. Guadalupe made sure every step was on point. The shape? Perfect. The length? Just right. And the colors, perfect. And let's not forget the way those polishes blended ‚Äì it was like magic. And that chrome finish? Flawless. She made sure I was happy with each part along the way too. And can we talk about how cute the salon is inside? Like, seriously, it's adorable. It adds to the whole experience, making it even better. Plus, the fact that Guadalupe has been in the neighborhood for over a decade makes her even more trustworthy. If you want nails that are not just beautiful but like actually perfect, Fierce Spa with Guadalupe is the spot. You won't be disappointed! üíÖüèº

originalText.text:
Update: Changed my review to 3 stars because the polish last only one day on my hands. You can see in the pics. I ended up having to remove my polish and repaint my own nails with colors I have. If I go again it will be only to do pedicure because the treatment for that was worth it and my toes still look good. I‚Äôll save myself money.

I was skeptical on trying this place out because of all the negative reviews. Then I decided this week that I didn‚Äôt feel like going to my regular spot and needed something new pedicure and manicure experience-wise. I saw this spot had a site to make appointments with, which I loved. I got there early but once the owner noticed me she let me in within 5 minutes and started preparing my order (I got the pink crystal pedicure and regular manicure). Chose my colors, and I was seated quickly. A lady named Ericka took care of me after the owner set up the water.

I had to tell the owner how beautiful her spot was because it really is, but she doesn‚Äôt seem to be the type to enjoy conversing much (very serious and almost cold..).

Ericka, on the other hand, was very sweet. This Pink crystal treatment was AMAZING. She put a mask on my legs, scrubbed my feet so well, making sure to get a lot of my dead skin off, and when fixing my nails made no negative comments - just did her duty and did it very gently! (I‚Äôm used to so many nail techs making comments on how short my toe nails are..which over time gets annoying‚Ä¶I am not paying you to comment on length).

Ericka also massaged my legs and feet and she took her time with the treatment. My toe nails came out beautiful.

Now, the only reason I give 4 stars is because of my experience with the manicure. Ericka was the one who started preparing my hands. I assumed at first she would be the one to finish off everything, but suddenly she asked me to move to another table where a young man ended up being the one taking care of me. First I was confused but then I realized more people were coming in and Ericka was taking over another customer.

The young man looked new to everything. They thought I only spoke English but I understood everything they said. I noticed the young man didn‚Äôt even know the difference of base coat and top coat and asked what to do. He also forgot to lotion my hands properly before the nail prep and then when painting my nails I had to tell him to do another coat because the color was off and didn‚Äôt look the way I wanted it to. He was nice, he just seemed to be a beginner and I would have preferred Ericka‚Äôs work on my hands.

It appears it‚Äôs a family run business though, so I understand if that may be a brother, nephew, or even son trying to learn the business to earn some coins. It‚Äôs also HIGHLY rare to see men doing nails, so I‚Äôm happy they‚Äôre breaking that barrier.

In the end I was satisfied with my experience. Their prices are on the high side, but for a once in a blue treatment special, I think it was worth it.
